title: Geneva Conventions adopted
text: The Geneva Conventions are adopted, creating the basis for modern international humanitarian law and obligating States Parties to prosecute or extradite suspected war criminals for “grave breaches.” This marks the first inclusion of the principal of universal jurisdiction in an international treaty.
extra:
Signing of the Geneva Convention

Credit: British Red Cross

title: Convention against Torture adopted
text: The Convention against Torture is adopted, obligating States Parties to prosecute or extradite suspected torturers.
extra:
Thirty-eighth Regular Session of the United Nations Commission on Human Rights.

Credit: UN Audiovisual Library of International Law

title: Rome Statute adopted
text: The Rome Statute is adopted by 120 States, establishing the International Criminal Court (ICC) and granting the Court jurisdiction over genocide, crimes against humanity, and war crimes.
extra:
1998: CICC applauds Rome Statute adoption

Credit: Coalition for the ICCo

title: Arrest of Augusto Pinochet
text: British police arrest former Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet in London for crimes committed during his 17-year rule, based on an international warrant linked to a case launched in Spain under the principle of universal jurisdiction. This marks the first time a current or former head of State is apprehended abroad for alleged international crimes.
extra:
Augusto Pinochet

Credit: From the Political History Archive of Biblioteca del Congreso Nacional de Chile

title: Conviction of Fulgence Niyonteze
text: A Swiss court convicts Rwandan national Fulgence Niyonteze of war crimes, marking the first trial and conviction related to the Rwandan genocide by a non-Rwandan national court.
extra:
Documentary: The Things We Don't Say: children of the Rwandan genocide.

Credit: The Guardian

title: Princeton Principles finalized
text: The Princeton Principles on Universal Jurisdiction are finalized, creating a set of consensus guidelines for the continued development and effective exercise of universal jurisdiction by national courts.
extra:
Princeton School of Public and International Affairs

Credit: Paul VanDerWerf

title: UN General Assembly Resolution
text: The UN General Assembly adopts a resolution at its 64th session asking the Secretary General to invite Member States to submit information on the scope and application of the principle of universal jurisdiction and assigning that issue to the Sixth Committee for further consideration.

title: Kampala Amendments adopted
text: The Kampala Amendments are adopted, defining and granting the ICC jurisdiction over the crime of aggression.
extra:
Promoting ratification and implementation of the Kampala Amendments.

Credit: Coalition for the ICC

title: Conviction of Pascal Simbikangwa
text: A French court convicts Rwandan national Pascal Simbikangwa of genocide and complicity in crimes against humanity for his role as the head of Rwanda’s Central Intelligence Service, marking the first trial and conviction in France of a Rwandan genocide suspect and the first case referred by France’s specialized unit for the prosecution of international crimes.
extra:
Alain Gauthier of the Collective of Civil Parties for Rwanda.

Credit: matelo971

title: Conviction of Hissène Habré
text: The Extraordinary African Chambers in Senegal convicts former Chadian President Hissène Habré of crimes against humanity and war crimes, marking the first universal jurisdiction prosecution in Africa and the first conviction of a former head of State by an African court for crimes against humanity.
extra:
Manuel Marín, Hissène Habré and Jacques Delors - 1989

Credit: EC Audiovisual Service

title: Conviction of Eyad al-Gharib
text: A German court convicts Syrian national and Assad regime member Eyad al-Gharib of aiding and abetting crimes against humanity, marking the first conviction worldwide for State-sponsored crimes against humanity in Syria.
extra:
Former Syrian official convicted by German court in first case of its kind

Credit: Channel 4 UK

title: Conviction of Taha Al-Jumailly
text: A German court convicts Iraqi national and former ISIS member Taha Al-Jumailly of genocide, crimes against humanity, and war crimes, marking the first genocide conviction worldwide of an ISIS member.
extra:
Documentary: A decade after genocide, Iraq's Yazidis make bittersweet return to Sinjar

Credit: France 24 English

title: Ljubljana-The Hague Convention
text: The Ljubljana-The Hague Convention is signed by 32 States, establishing new standards for inter-State cooperation to facilitate the investigation and prosecution of the most serious international crimes.
extra:
Signing conference Ljubljana-The Hague Convention in the Peace Palace

Credit: Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs

title: Conviction of Ousman Sonko
text: A Swiss court convicts former Gambian Minister of the Interior Ousman Sonko of crimes against humanity, making him the highest-ranking State official prosecuted under universal jurisdiction in a European court to date.
extra:
Former Gambia Minister Ousman Sonko on trial for crimes against humanity

Credit: France 24 English

title: Conviction of Yan Petrovsky
text: A Finnish court convicts Russian national and far-right mercenary leader Yan Petrovsky of war crimes committed by mercenaries under his command in Luhansk, eastern Ukraine, marking the first conviction under universal jurisdiction worldwide for war crimes committed in Ukraine.
extra:
Helsinki Court Convicts Russian Of War Crimes In Ukraine During 2014

Credit: Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty
